description.narrative: The Project will allow commercialization of a unique business model of the Client by supporting the construction and operation of solar hybrid systems to off-grid telecom towers and co-located villages for delivery of energy services to rural communities. The Project will also support the Client's expansion into C&I segment. The main project outcome is increased access to electricity for communities in rural and conflict affected areas as well improvement in quality and affordability of electricity for tower operators and C&I customers. The Project is expected to have positive environmental impact by displacing CO2 emissions. Beyond the Project, the investment contributes to market inclusiveness and competitiveness by demonstrating a viable business model for distributed renewable energy solutions that other investors can replicate within the region. The investment is Gender Flagged investment and as such, the company, with assistance from IFC's Gender Business, is committed to employ more women in non-traditional jobs in the company, such as engineering, procurement and other careers promoting women in professional roles. Gender sensitive recruitment processes will be developed and monitored by for progress to increase the female ratio of employees within the company.

Yoma Micro Power (YMP or the Company) is a solar/hybrid distributed generation developer in Myanmar selling to an anchor telecom tower client operating in off-grid areas, along with rural communities and Commercial and Industrial (C&I) offtake clients. Based on successful implementation of the 250-tower site/15 (of 25) community electrification (the Pilot) in March 2020, the Company now seeks additional capital to continue its expansion, over the coming 58 months (through FYE24), to 2,000 tower sites, 375 community electrification sites and 30MWs of C&I rooftop power (the Project).
